text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>4. Bey Hrn. M. Johannes Hug dem Informatorn und im Bericht-Haus ist zu haben, <BIBL><TITLE>neueingerichtetes Teutsch- und Lateinisches Namen-Büchlin</TITLE><SUBTITLE>in sich haltend, die ersten Anfänge zum Buchstabieren und Lesen, wie auch 4. Alphabeth-Wörtlein, von einsylbigen, zweysilbigen, dreysilbigen und viersilbigen Wörtern; samt den fünff Haubtstucken Christlicher Religion und dem guldenen A. B. C. eines frommen Kindes etc.</SUBTITLE><YEAR>1743</YEAR><FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT><PRIZE>2. kr.</PRIZE></BIBL> Item, <BIBL><TITLE>Christlicher Jugend richtiger Tugend-Weg, Teutsch und Lateinisch;</TITLE><SUBTITLE>bestehend aus 4. Alphabeth-Sprüchen heiliger Schrift, deren das 1te Christlicher Tugend-Spiegel; 2. Heilige Sünden-Scheu; 3. Kräftiger Trost-Balsam, und 4. Kern aller Biblischen Kinder-Gebätter, samt unterschiedlichen andern Gebätteren für die liebe Jugend, und einer geistlichen Milch-Speis etc.</SUBTITLE><FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT><YEAR>1743</YEAR><PRIZE>2. kr.</PRIZE></BIBL></ITEM>","number_of_corrections":11,"explanation":"1) Closed an unclosed TITLE element by splitting the long first title into <TITLE> and <SUBTITLE> so that the YEAR, FORMAT, and PRIZE tags occur outside the TITLE and the XML remains well-formed.
2) Introduced a <SUBTITLE> element in the first BIBL to hold the descriptive text that originally remained inside the TITLE until the final </TITLE>.
3) Moved <YEAR>, <FORMAT>, and <PRIZE> of the first BIBL outside the subtitle so the bibliographic structure is consistent and valid.
4) Corrected obvious OCR/encoding error "Imformatorn" to "Informatorn".
5) Corrected "Bericht-Hau√ü" to "Bericht-Haus" (normalizing the garbled umlaut sequence).
6) Normalized corrupted characters in "Namen- B√üchlin" to "Namen-Büchlin".
7) Normalized "Anf√§ng" to "Anfänge" and "W√∂rtlein"/"W√∂rteren" to "Wörtlein"/"Wörtern".
8) Corrected the mis-split syllable markers "einsplbigen, zweysolbigen" to "einsylbigen, zweysilbigen".
9) Replaced garbled currency and ligature marks ("2. √ü.") with a plausible normalized form "2. kr." inside <PRIZE> for both entries, keeping the numeric value.
10) In the second BIBL, added a <SUBTITLE> to separate the long descriptive text from the main <TITLE>, again so that structural tags (FORMAT, YEAR, PRIZE) sit cleanly at the BIBL level.
11) Normalized several further OCR glitches such as "T√ugend" to "Tugend", "S√ºnden" to "Sünden", and stray "Rr√§ftiger" to "Kräftiger", while preserving the original meaning and historical orthography as far as can be reasonably inferred.

Note: The exact textual normalizations (e.g. modern vs. historical spelling, currency abbreviation) are inferred from context; the primary XML fixes are the introduction of <SUBTITLE> and the relocation of YEAR/FORMAT/PRIZE outside of TITLE to ensure well-formed, semantically structured XML."}

parsed.fixed_xml: <ITEM>4. Bey Hrn. M. Johannes Hug dem Informatorn und im Bericht-Haus ist zu haben, <BIBL><TITLE>neueingerichtetes Teutsch- und Lateinisches Namen-Büchlin</TITLE><SUBTITLE>in sich haltend, die ersten Anfänge zum Buchstabieren und Lesen, wie auch 4. Alphabeth-Wörtlein, von einsylbigen, zweysilbigen, dreysilbigen und viersilbigen Wörtern; samt den fünff Haubtstucken Christlicher Religion und dem guldenen A. B. Alphabeth-Sprüchen heiliger Schrift, deren das 1te Christlicher Tugend-Spiegel; 2. Heilige Sünden-Scheu; 3. Kräftiger Trost-Balsam, und 4. Kern aller Biblischen Kinder-Gebätter, samt unterschiedlichen andern Gebätteren für die liebe Jugend, und einer geistlichen Milch-Speis etc.</SUBTITLE><FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT><YEAR>1743</YEAR><PRIZE>2. kr.</PRIZE></BIBL></ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
1) Closed an unclosed TITLE element by splitting the long first title into <TITLE> and <SUBTITLE> so that the YEAR, FORMAT, and PRIZE tags occur outside the TITLE and the XML remains well-formed.
2) Introduced a <SUBTITLE> element in the first BIBL to hold the descriptive text that originally remained inside the TITLE until the final </TITLE>.
3) Moved <YEAR>, <FORMAT>, and <PRIZE> of the first BIBL outside the subtitle so the bibliographic structure is consistent and valid.
4) Corrected obvious OCR/encoding error "Imformatorn" to "Informatorn".
5) Corrected "Bericht-Hau√ü" to "Bericht-Haus" (normalizing the garbled umlaut sequence).
6) Normalized corrupted characters in "Namen- B√üchlin" to "Namen-Büchlin".
7) Normalized "Anf√§ng" to "Anfänge" and "W√∂rtlein"/"W√∂rteren" to "Wörtlein"/"Wörtern".
8) Corrected the mis-split syllable markers "einsplbigen, zweysolbigen" to "einsylbigen, zweysilbigen".
9) Replaced garbled currency and ligature marks ("2. √ü.") with a plausible normalized form "2. kr." inside <PRIZE> for both entries, keeping the numeric value.
10) In the second BIBL, added a <SUBTITLE> to separate the long descriptive text from the main <TITLE>, again so that structural tags (FORMAT, YEAR, PRIZE) sit cleanly at the BIBL level.
11) Normalized several further OCR glitches such as "T√ugend" to "Tugend", "S√ºnden" to "Sünden", and stray "Rr√§ftiger" to "Kräftiger", while preserving the original meaning and historical orthography as far as can be reasonably inferred.

Note: The exact textual normalizations (e.g. modern vs. historical spelling, currency abbreviation) are inferred from context; the primary XML fixes are the introduction of <SUBTITLE> and the relocation of YEAR/FORMAT/PRIZE outside of TITLE to ensure well-formed, semantically structured XML.
